Articles.Content: Found this wonderful .gif that shows what a Hohmann transfer orbit looks like.
so, a TMI is the first half of a Hohmann transfer?
I honestly don\'t know; I saw the post and immediately went 'Rocketry stuff!', then posted it here.
So I\'ve been doing Hohmann transfers all this time, without even knowing what it is

so, a TMI is the first half of a Hohmann transfer?

More correctly, it\'s just a lengthening of an orbit. A Hohmann transfer consists of two such lengthenings, and a bi-elliptic would consist of two lengthenings, and one shortening.

so, a TMI is the first half of a Hohmann transfer?

Or to put it another way, a Trans Munar Injection (TMI) burn is the first half of a Hohmann and then a burn to stabilise orbit/land around the moon instead of around Kerbin. AKA burn to get out there, burn to not crash!

so, a TMI is the first half of a Hohmann transfer?

Yes.
